0: Materials from Inquiry into Circumstances Surrounding Trump Tower Meeting NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR As a part of its oversight of the Justice Department’s enforcement of the Foreign Agents Registration Act and federal investigations into potential improper influence during the 2016 presidential election, the Senate Judiciary Committee conducted bipartisan staff interviews with and submitted written questions to witnesses regarding circumstances surrounding the June 9, 2016, Trump Tower meeting. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The following witnesses were interviewed for this portion of the committee’s investigation: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Glenn Simpson (interviewed August 22, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Subsequent letters NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ClarificationRequest (sent January 11, 2018) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Response (received January 18, 2018) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Donald J. Trump, Jr. (interviewed September 7, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Irakly “Ike” Kaveladze (interviewed November 3, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Supplemental Interview (interviewed March 23, 2018) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Anatoli Samochornov (interviewed November 8, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Rinat Akhmetshin (interviewed November 14, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Robert Goldstone (interviewed December 15, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Supplemental Interview (interviewed March 29, 2018) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The following witnesses declined to be interviewed by the committee, but submitted material relevant to the investigation: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jared Kushner (material received July 24, 2017) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Paul Manafort (material received July 25,
